comments:
I had the error log view open and showing an imported log. Then I wanted to clean up the log and did the following:
- pressed 'Import Log' and navigated in the file chooser dialog to the displayed log files
- deleted the log files in the file chooser
- closed the dialog with cancel
- pressed 'Clear Log Viewer'

Then the eclipse crashed/terminated/closed/disappeared/... immediatly. The following exception is listed 5 times in my platforms error log.

-- Error Log --
Date: Fri May 11 08:15:05 GMT+01:00 2007
Message: Unhandled event loop exception
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.ui
Stack Trace:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Widget is disposed
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3534)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3457)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3428)

at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:325)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Text.setText(Text.java:1792)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView.onMouseHover(LogView.java:873)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.runtime.logview.LogView$20.handleEvent(LogView.java:801)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)

at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:461)

at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.application.IDEApplication.start(IDEApplication.java:101)
at org.eclipse.equinox.internal.app.EclipseAppHandle.run(EclipseAppHandle.java:153)

Fixed by making sure the text shell is not disposed before we try to do stuff onMouseHover.
